<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/04/25/movie-coming-tonight?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Is There a Movie Coming Out Tonight?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000"><em>Monoculture (n.): </em></strong><em>A culture dominated by a single element; a prevailing culture marked by homogeneity. </em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Media insiders like to say there exist no more monocultural events outside of sports and <em>Game of Thrones</em>. But the levels of hype surrounding tonight’s release of <em>Avengers: Endgame </em>show that this jolly gang of superheroes still dominates the global consciousness like no other.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">At the Brew, we like to measure hype in $$$$</h2>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://deadline.com/2019/04/avengers-endgame-box-office-advance-ticket-sales-opening-weekend-records-1202599744/" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Deadline</a></span><span> estimates domestic ticket sales could brush up against $140 million...</span><span><em>before the movie comes out tonight</em></span><span>.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>There’s a chance </span><span><em>Endgame </em></span><span>could rake in close to $1 billion globally this weekend. When the movie opened in </span><span><a href="https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/avengers-endgame-box-office-preps-record-850m-900m-global-bow-1203880?utm_source=t.co&utm_medium=referral" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">China</a></span><span> yesterday, it posted an </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-walt-disney-avengers-china/disneys-avengers-endgame-sets-opening-day-record-in-china-idUSKCN1S021W" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">opening day record</a></span><span> of $107.2 million in ticket sales.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Over a dozen AMC locations will be open </span><span><a href="https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/avengers-endgame-amc-theatres-adds-record-number-round-clock-shows-1203781" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">96 hours straight</a></span><span> because there's so much demand. </span><span><strong style="color:#000">Q: </strong></span><span>How much movie theater soda is acceptable to consume during a 7:30am showing?  </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And just when you thought we couldn’t have it all...the reviews are <a href="https://www.rollingstone.com/movies/movie-reviews/avengers-endgame-movie-review-marvel-825435/" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">glowing</a>.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Zooming out on Disney’s MCU</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Endgame</em> is the <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/avengers-endgame-prompts-theaters-to-plan-24-hour-screenings-double-the-popcorn-11556098200" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">final chapter</a> in a run of 22 movies in the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU), starting with <em>Iron Man</em> in 2008. Collectively they’ve earned $18.6 billion at the box office and smashed one Hollywood record after the other.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But as much of a slam dunk as it seems now, the MCU was originally a risky, experimental play. The NYT <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/04/18/movies/avengers-endgame-robert-downey-jr.html" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sets the scene</a>:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“Marvel’s prosperous future was hardly a certainty a decade or so ago.”</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“In the mid-2000s it was a smaller, inexperienced company that controlled the film rights for only a few of its lesser-known characters...at a time when no one in Hollywood was yet contemplating the idea of an interconnected universe of superhero movies.”</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That interconnected universe of superhero movies is culminating this weekend in the cinematic event of the decade. And it’s up to Disney to make sure the monoculture doesn’t stop there.</p>

</a><span>  </span>

</tr>
</table>

</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/04/25/facebook-s-just-fine?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Facebook's Doing Just Fine
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/6/61/Mark_Zuckerberg_F8_2018_Keynote_%2841118890874%29.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="540" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 540px;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup class="sub-text"><a href="https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Mark_Zuckerberg_F8_2018_Keynote_(41118890874).jpg?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Wikimedia Commons</em></a></sup></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Emphasis on the fine. Facebook (+7.7% after hours) divulged in its <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/04/24/facebook-earnings-q1-2019.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">earnings report</a> yesterday that it’s earmarked $3 billion to pay an expected Federal Trade Commission fine over privacy issues.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The FTC launched a probe into FB following the Cambridge Analytica scandal.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The “matter remains unresolved,” but the final charge </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/04/24/facebook-estimates-up-to-5-billion-loss-in-ftc-privacy-inquiry.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">could be</a></span><span> up to $5 billion.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">That cut into FB’s profits</strong>, which totaled $2.4 billion on revenue of $15.1 billion. While Zuck’s top line number jumped 26% annually, earnings shrank and missed estimates. Without the $3 billion set aside for the FTC, Facebook would’ve <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/facebook-sets-aside-3-billion-to-cover-expected-ftc-fine-11556137113?mod=hp_lead_pos1" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">easily topped</a> profit estimates.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Still, Zuck’s underlying business is doing...fine.</strong> Across its family of apps, Facebook tallied 2.7 billion monthly users and raked in an average of $6.42 in revenue per user, up 16% from a year ago.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Facebook is staring down an avalanche of scandals and international probes. But Zuck is like the Energizer Bunny—no matter how many memes we make of him, he just keeps <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-04-24/facebook-revenue-tops-estimates-legal-costs-cut-into-earnings?srnd=premium" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">winning ad dollars</a> and adding users.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AVIATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/04/25/boeing-gives?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Boeing Gives Up
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The company <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/04/24/boeing-earnings-q1-2019.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">opened its books</a> for the first time since last month’s Ethiopian Airlines disaster, which a) marked the second deadly crash of Boeing’s 737 Max in five months and b) exposed safety practices that worried some aviation experts. There was significant financial damage as Boeing (+0.36%) tried to contain a growing crisis: </p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Boeing missed earnings estimates for only the second time in five years. </strong></span><span>Q1 revenue fell 2%. Pair that with the </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-04-24/boeing-suspends-forecast-on-grounding-of-737-max-shares-fall?srnd=premium" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">growing costs</a></span><span> of lawsuits and investigations, pilot training, and a delayed software update, and you get core earnings of $3.16/share, down 13% annually.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Widespread groundings of the 737 Max cost Boeing over $1 billion. </strong></span><span>Its commercial airplanes segment suffered a $1 billion decline in </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/04/24/business/boeing-earnings-737-max.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">revenue</a></span><span> without the bestseller shipping out.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Boeing is abandoning its forecast for the rest of the year. </strong></span><span>The guidance it previously issued “</span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/boeing-forecasts-initial-1-billion-hit-from-737-max-troubles-11556106144?mod=hp_lead_pos2" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">does not reflect</a></span><span> 737 Max impacts,” Boeing said. “New guidance will be issued at a future date” because of “uncertainty of timing and conditions.”</span>
</li>
</ol>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENERGY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/04/25/one-big-energy-deal-endless-cliches?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
One Big Energy Deal, Endless Clichés
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Earlier this month, Chevron (-3.04%) inked a deal to buy Anadarko Petroleum (+11.58%) for $33 billion, putting primo access to the lucrative Permian Basin within Chevron’s reach. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/stories/ultra-major-status-is-within-chevrons-reach/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">We knew then</a> that rival Occidental Petroleum (-0.56%) had previously pitched a deal to Anadarko...</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">But yesterday, things got serious.</strong> Occidental unveiled a new $38 billion takeover bid for Anadarko. Now, we’re left wondering a) who will dominate the U.S.’ most productive oil field and b) how many clichés can we use to describe one potential bidding war?</p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">It’s David versus Goliath.</strong></span><span> Chevron is </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/04/24/business/dealbook/occidental-anadarko-chevron.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">four times</a></span><span> the size of Occidental. But Occidental slid quite the deal across the table, promising about 17% more for Anadarko than Chevron did.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Persistence is key.</strong></span><span> Occidental first </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/occidental-petroleum-bids-for-anadarko-11556105549?mod=hp_lead_pos1" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">started courting</a></span><span> Anadarko in July 2017 and just made its </span><span><em>fourth</em></span><span> bid. But Anadarko is head-over-heels for Chevron’s international influence.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Don’t count your chickens. </strong></span><span>It’s not clear if Chevron will sweeten the deal (and spark a bidding war). But Anadarko would have to pay a $1 billion breakup fee if things with Chevron fell apart.</span>
</li>
</ol>

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86574d1eb82.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://www.linkedin.com/shareArticle?mini=true&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F04%2F25%2Fone-big-energy-deal-endless-cliches&title=One+Big+Energy+Deal%2C+Endless+Clich%C3%A9s&source=www.morningbrew.com&summary=Who+will+dominate+the+U.S.%E2%80%99s+most+productive+oil+field%3F+" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86576e04837.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
</td>

</table>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/04/25/many-automakers-take-change-industry?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
How Many Automakers Does It Take to Change an Industry?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://media.rivian.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/R1T_16-768x512.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="540" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 540px;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup class="sub-text"><a href="https://media.rivian.com/photo_gallery/r1t/" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Rivian</em></a></sup></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some things in life are best accomplished solo, like meditation and climbing El Capitan. For other tasks, such as building electric vehicles, you need all the help you can get.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’s why Ford (+0.74%) is <a href="https://apnews.com/a08e006a343f4a8f98af6e840888c20e" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">investing $500 million</a> in electric truck startup Rivian. Because even though Ford’s <em>already </em>committed $11 billion to electric vehicles, the transition to battery-powered cars is so darn expensive that it nearly demands automakers team up with one another to get the job done.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">To kick off the partnership, </strong>the two will co-develop an electric pickup truck. What will Rivian bring to the assembly line?</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Rivian knows that a truck is only as cool as the canoe you stick on the roof. So it’s building some electric trucks with </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/ford-accelerates-its-electric-vehicle-push-with-500-million-stake-in-rivian-11556107204" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">outdoor adventures</a></span><span> in mind—a range of 400 miles per charge and off-road capabilities.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>But think more Patagonia glamping than Bangkok backpacker hostel. Rivian’s pickup truck and SUV will likely </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/04/24/business/ford-rivian-investment.html" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">start</a></span><span> at $68,000 each, putting them in competition with models from Porsche and Tesla.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Speaking of which...</strong>Tesla <a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/tesla-stock-falls-after-car-maker-misses-q1-views-2019-04-24" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reported</a> a wider-than-expected adjusted loss <em>and</em> missed revenue forecasts for the first quarter.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eZooming out on Disney’s MCU\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eEndgame\u003c/em\u003e is the \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/avengers-endgame-prompts-theaters-to-plan-24-hour-screenings-double-the-popcorn-11556098200\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efinal chapter\u003c/a\u003e in a run of 22 movies in the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU), starting with \u003cem\u003eIron Man\u003c/em\u003e in 2008. Collectively they’ve earned $18.6 billion at the box office and smashed one Hollywood record after the other.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut as much of a slam dunk as it seems now, the MCU was originally a risky, experimental play. The NYT \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/04/18/movies/avengers-endgame-robert-downey-jr.html\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esets the scene\u003c/a\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“Marvel’s prosperous future was hardly a certainty a decade or so ago.”\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“In the mid-2000s it was a smaller, inexperienced company that controlled the film rights for only a few of its lesser-known characters...at a time when no one in Hollywood was yet contemplating the idea of an interconnected universe of superhero movies.”\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat interconnected universe of superhero movies is culminating this weekend in the cinematic event of the decade. Facebook (+7.7% after hours) divulged in its \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/04/24/facebook-earnings-q1-2019.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eearnings report\u003c/a\u003e yesterday that it’s earmarked $3 billion to pay an expected Federal Trade Commission fine over privacy issues.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe FTC launched a probe into FB following the Cambridge Analytica scandal.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe “matter remains unresolved,” but the final charge \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/04/24/facebook-estimates-up-to-5-billion-loss-in-ftc-privacy-inquiry.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecould be\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e up to $5 billion.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThat cut into FB’s profits\u003c/strong\u003e, which totaled $2.4 billion on revenue of $15.1 billion. While Zuck’s top line number jumped 26% annually, earnings shrank and missed estimates. Without the $3 billion set aside for the FTC, Facebook would’ve \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/facebook-sets-aside-3-billion-to-cover-expected-ftc-fine-11556137113?mod=hp_lead_pos1\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eeasily topped\u003c/a\u003e profit estimates.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eStill, Zuck’s underlying business is doing...fine.\u003c/strong\u003e Across its family of apps, Facebook tallied 2.7 billion monthly users and raked in an average of $6.42 in revenue per user, up 16% from a year ago.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eFacebook is staring down an avalanche of scandals and international probes. But Zuck is like the Energizer Bunny—no matter how many memes we make of him, he just keeps \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-04-24/facebook-revenue-tops-estimates-legal-costs-cut-into-earnings?srnd=premium\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewinning ad dollars\u003c/a\u003e and adding users.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe company \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/04/24/boeing-earnings-q1-2019.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eopened its books\u003c/a\u003e for the first time since last month’s Ethiopian Airlines disaster, which a) marked the second deadly crash of Boeing’s 737 Max in five months and b) exposed safety practices that worried some aviation experts. There was significant financial damage as Boeing (+0.36%) tried to contain a growing crisis: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003col\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBoeing missed earnings estimates for only the second time in five years. \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eQ1 revenue fell 2%. Pair that with the \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-04-24/boeing-suspends-forecast-on-grounding-of-737-max-shares-fall?srnd=premium\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egrowing costs\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e of lawsuits and investigations, pilot training, and a delayed software update, and you get core earnings of $3.16/share, down 13% annually.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWidespread groundings of the 737 Max cost Boeing over $1 billion. \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIts commercial airplanes segment suffered a $1 billion decline in \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/04/24/business/boeing-earnings-737-max.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erevenue\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e without the bestseller shipping out.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBoeing is abandoning its forecast for the rest of the year. \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe guidance it previously issued “\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/boeing-forecasts-initial-1-billion-hit-from-737-max-troubles-11556106144?mod=hp_lead_pos2\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edoes not reflect\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e 737 Max impacts,” Boeing said. “New guidance will be issued at a future date” because of “uncertainty of timing and conditions.”\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ol\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nOne Big Energy Deal, Endless Clichés\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEarlier this month, Chevron (-3.04%) inked a deal to buy Anadarko Petroleum (+11.58%) for $33 billion, putting primo access to the lucrative Permian Basin within Chevron’s reach. \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/stories/ultra-major-status-is-within-chevrons-reach/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eWe knew then\u003c/a\u003e that rival Occidental Petroleum (-0.56%) had previously pitched a deal to Anadarko...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBut yesterday, things got serious.\u003c/strong\u003e Occidental unveiled a new $38 billion takeover bid for Anadarko. Now, we’re left wondering a) who will dominate the U.S.’ most productive oil field and b) how many clichés can we use to describe one potential bidding war?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003col\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIt’s David versus Goliath.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Chevron is \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/04/24/business/dealbook/occidental-anadarko-chevron.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efour times\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e the size of Occidental. But Occidental slid quite the deal across the table, promising about 17% more for Anadarko than Chevron did.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ePersistence is key.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Occidental first \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/occidental-petroleum-bids-for-anadarko-11556105549?mod=hp_lead_pos1\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estarted courting\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Anadarko in July 2017 and just made its \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003efourth\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e bid. But Anadarko is head-over-heels for Chevron’s international influence.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eDon’t count your chickens. \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt’s not clear if Chevron will sweeten the deal (and spark a bidding war). But Anadarko would have to pay a $1 billion breakup fee if things with Chevron fell apart.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ol\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable Industry?\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://media.rivian.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/R1T_16-768x512.jpg\" class=\"img-responsive\" width=\"540\" style=\"width:100% !important;max-width: 540px;\" alt=\"\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003csup class=\"sub-text\"\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://media.rivian.com/photo_gallery/r1t/\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eRivian\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/sup\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSome things in life are best accomplished solo, like meditation and climbing El Capitan. For other tasks, such as building electric vehicles, you need all the help you can get.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat’s why Ford (+0.74%) is \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/a08e006a343f4a8f98af6e840888c20e\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003einvesting $500 million\u003c/a\u003e in electric truck startup Rivian. Because even though Ford’s \u003cem\u003ealready \u003c/em\u003ecommitted $11 billion to electric vehicles, the transition to battery-powered cars is so darn expensive that it nearly demands automakers team up with one another to get the job done.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTo kick off the partnership, \u003c/strong\u003ethe two will co-develop an electric pickup truck. What will Rivian bring to the assembly line?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eRivian knows that a truck is only as cool as the canoe you stick on the roof. So it’s building some electric trucks with \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/ford-accelerates-its-electric-vehicle-push-with-500-million-stake-in-rivian-11556107204\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eoutdoor adventures\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in mind—a range of 400 miles per charge and off-road capabilities.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eBut think more Patagonia glamping than Bangkok backpacker hostel. Rivian’s pickup truck and SUV will likely \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/04/24/business/ford-rivian-investment.html\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estart\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e at $68,000 each, putting them in competition with models from Porsche and Tesla.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSpeaking of which...\u003c/strong\u003eTesla \u003ca href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/tesla-stock-falls-after-car-maker-misses-q1-views-2019-04-24\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereported\u003c/a\u003e a wider-than-expected adjusted loss \u003cem\u003eand\u003c/em\u003e missed revenue forecasts for the first quarter.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F04%2F25%2Fmany-automakers-take-change-industry\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block;
